results.title: The combined anti-osteoporotic effects of simvastatin and exercise in ovariectomized mice fed a high-fat diet.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: The coexistence of @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@ and @DISEASE_Hereditary_Angioedema_Type_III @DISEASE_MESH:D056828 @@@estrogen deficiency@@@ further aggravates @DISEASE_Neoplasms_Bone_Tissue @DISEASE_MESH:D018213 @@@bone tissue degeneration@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormal@@@ metabolic pathology, which could be better inhibited by the combination with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and exercise instead of single intervention, suggesting that combined intervention may be a potential candidate for amelioration of the progression of @DISEASE_Osteoporosis @DISEASE_MESH:D010024 @@@OP@@@.

citations.NLM: Li H, Gou Y, Tian F, Lian Q, Hu Y, Zhang L. The combined anti-osteoporotic effects of simvastatin and exercise in ovariectomized mice fed a high-fat diet. Exp Gerontol. 2022 Jul;164():111794. PMID: 35421557
citations.BibTeX: @article{35421557, title={The combined anti-osteoporotic effects of simvastatin and exercise in ovariectomized mice fed a high-fat diet.}, author={Li H and Gou Y and Tian F and Lian Q and Hu Y and Zhang L}, journal={Exp Gerontol}, volume={164}, pages={111794}}

results.title: Haemostatic effects of simvastatin in subjects with impaired glucose tolerance.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Compared to the control subjects, hypercholesterolaemic and @DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@IGT@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ exhibited increased baseline plasma levels of @GENE_FGB @GENE_2244 @@@fibrinogen@@@, @GENE_SERPINE1 @GENE_5054 @@@PAI-1@@@ and @GENE_VWF @GENE_7450 @@@vWF@@@, and increased @GENE_F7 @GENE_2155 @@@factor VII@@@ activity, with no difference between the two groups of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@. All these @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@haemostatic abnormalities@@@ were alleviated or normalized after @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment, which was accompanied by a prolongation of the prothrombin and partial thromboplastin time.

citations.NLM: Krysiak R, Okopien B. Haemostatic effects of simvastatin in subjects with impaired glucose tolerance. Intern Med J. 2011 Jun;41(6):473-81. PMID: 21118403
citations.BibTeX: @article{21118403, title={Haemostatic effects of simvastatin in subjects with impaired glucose tolerance.}, author={Krysiak R and Okopien B}, journal={Intern Med J}, volume={41}, number={6}, pages={473-81}}

results.title: Comparable renovascular protective effects of moxonidine and simvastatin in rats exposed to cigarette smoke.
results.text_hl: Simultaneous administration of @CHEMICAL_moxonidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C043482 @@@moxonidine@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ abolished CS-induced @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormalities in@@@ indices @DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@of renal function@@@, NOx, and vasodilations caused by @CHEMICAL_Carbachol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002217 @@@carbachol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@.

citations.NLM: Nasr MA, El-Gowilly SM, El-Mas MM. Comparable renovascular protective effects of moxonidine and simvastatin in rats exposed to cigarette smoke. Vascul Pharmacol. 2010 Jul-Aug;53(1-2):53-60. PMID: 20350618
citations.BibTeX: @article{20350618, title={Comparable renovascular protective effects of moxonidine and simvastatin in rats exposed to cigarette smoke.}, author={Nasr MA and El-Gowilly SM and El-Mas MM}, journal={Vascul Pharmacol}, volume={53}, number={1-2}, pages={53-60}}

results.title: Crossover trial of simvastatin versus pravastatin in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia.
results.text_hl: ...The effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ administered alone at initial doses of 5 and 10 mg/day, respectively, on normalization of @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormal@@@ lipid metabolism in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@ were evaluated by a crossover method.

citations.NLM: Sasaki S, Sawada S, Nakata T, Itoh H, Takeda K, Nakagawa M, Kuriyama K. Crossover trial of simvastatin versus pravastatin in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1997 Jul;30(1):142-7. PMID: 9268234
